info.title: ePI FHIR Capability Statement (draft 1)
info.description: This section describes a minumum expected capabilities of an ePI FHIR Server which is responsible for providing responses to the queries submitted by the ePI clients. Please refer to the XML or JSON versions of this specification for details on which elements search is to be enabled on. A compliant server SHALL adhere to the requirements listed in this resource, and implement the RESTful behavior according to the FHIR specification.

/metadata.summary: Access to the Server's Capability Statement
/metadata.description: All FHIR Servers return a CapabilityStatement that describes what services they perform

get.summary: Return the server's capability statement

/AdministrableProductDefinition.summary: manage the collection of resources of type AdministrableProductDefinition
/AdministrableProductDefinition.description: Access to services to manage the collection of all resources of type AdministrableProductDefinition

get.summary: Search all resources of type AdministrableProductDefinition based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: An identifier for the administrable product

parameters.name: manufactured-item
parameters.description: The manufactured item(s) that this administrable product is produced from. Either a single item, or several that are mixed before administration (e.g. a power item and a solution item). Note that these are not raw ingredients

parameters.name: ingredient
parameters.description: The ingredients of this administrable medicinal product

parameters.name: route
parameters.description: Coded expression for the route

parameters.name: dose-form
parameters.description: The administrable dose form, i.e. the dose form of the final product after necessary reconstitution or processing

parameters.name: device
parameters.description: A device that is integral to the medicinal product, in effect being considered as an "ingredient" of the medicinal product. This is not intended for devices that are just co-packaged

parameters.name: form-of
parameters.description: The medicinal product that this is an administrable form of. This is not a reference to the item(s) that make up this administrable form - it is the whole product

parameters.name: target-species
parameters.description: Coded expression for the species

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status of this administrable product. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

/AdministrableProductDefinition/{rid}.summary: Read/Write/etc resource instance of type AdministrableProductDefinition
/AdministrableProductDefinition/{rid}.description: Access to services to manage the state of a single resource of type AdministrableProductDefinition

get.summary: Read the current state of the resource

ETag.description: Version from Resource.meta.version as a weak ETag

/AdministrableProductDefinition/{rid}/_h.description: Access to previous versions of a single resource of type AdministrableProductDefinition

get.summary: Read the past states of the resource

parameters.name: _since
parameters.description: Only include resource versions that were created at or after the given instant in time

parameters.name: _at
parameters.description: Only include resource versions that were current at some point during the time period specified in the date time value (see Search notes on date searching)

parameters.name: _list
parameters.description: Only include resource versions that are referenced in the specified list (current list references are allowed)

/AdministrableProductDefinition/{rid}/_h.description: Access a to specified previous version of a single resource of type AdministrableProductDefinition

/AdministrableProductDefinition/_history.description: Access to previous versions of resourcez of type AdministrableProductDefinition

/Bundle.summary: manage the collection of resources of type Bundle
/Bundle.description: Access to services to manage the collection of all resources of type Bundle

get.summary: Search all resources of type Bundle based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Persistent identifier for the bundle

parameters.name: composition
parameters.description: The first resource in the bundle, if the bundle type is "document" - this is a composition, and this parameter provides access to search its contents

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The first resource in the bundle, if the bundle type is "message" - this is a message header, and this parameter provides access to search its contents

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: document | message | transaction | transaction-response | batch | batch-response | history | searchset | collection | subscription-notification

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: When the bundle was assembled

/CapabilityStatement.summary: manage the collection of resources of type CapabilityStatement
/CapabilityStatement.description: Access to services to manage the collection of all resources of type CapabilityStatement

get.summary: Search all resources of type CapabilityStatement based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The capability statement publication date

parameters.name: resource-profile
parameters.description: A profile id invoked in a capability statement

parameters.name: context-type-value
parameters.description: A use context type and value assigned to the capability statement

parameters.name: software
parameters.description: Part of the name of a software application

parameters.name: resource
parameters.description: Name of a resource mentioned in a capability statement

parameters.name: jurisdiction
parameters.description: Intended jurisdiction for the capability statement

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: formats supported (xml | json | ttl | mime type)

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The description of the capability statement

parameters.name: context-type
parameters.description: A type of use context assigned to the capability statement

parameters.name: fhirversion
parameters.description: The version of FHIR

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The human-friendly name of the capability statement

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The business version of the capability statement

parameters.name: supported-profile
parameters.description: Profiles for use cases supported

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The uri that identifies the capability statement

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Mode - restful (server/client) or messaging (sender/receiver)

parameters.name: context-quantity
parameters.description: A quantity- or range-valued use context assigned to the capability statement

parameters.name: security-service
parameters.description: OAuth | SMART-on-FHIR | NTLM | Basic | Kerberos | Certificates

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: A use context assigned to the capability statement

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Computationally friendly name of the capability statement

parameters.name: publisher
parameters.description: Name of the publisher of the capability statement

parameters.name: context-type-quantity
parameters.description: A use context type and quantity- or range-based value assigned to the capability statement

parameters.name: guide
parameters.description: Implementation guides supported

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The current status of the capability statement

/ClinicalUseDefinition.summary: manage the collection of resources of type ClinicalUseDefinition
/ClinicalUseDefinition.description: Access to services to manage the collection of all resources of type ClinicalUseDefinition

get.summary: Search all resources of type ClinicalUseDefinition based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: contraindication-reference
parameters.description: The situation that is being documented as contraindicating against this item, as a reference

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Business identifier for this issue

parameters.name: indication-reference
parameters.description: The situation that is being documented as an indicaton for this item, as a reference

parameters.name: product
parameters.description: The medicinal product for which this is a clinical usage issue

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: The resource for which this is a clinical usage issue

parameters.name: effect
parameters.description: The situation in which the undesirable effect may manifest, as a code

parameters.name: interaction
parameters.description: The type of the interaction e.g. drug-drug interaction, drug-food interaction, drug-lab test interaction

parameters.name: indication
parameters.description: The situation that is being documented as an indicaton for this item, as a code

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: indication | contraindication | interaction | undesirable-effect | warning

parameters.name: contraindication
parameters.description: The situation that is being documented as contraindicating against this item, as a code

parameters.name: effect-reference
parameters.description: The situation in which the undesirable effect may manifest, as a reference

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Whether this is a current issue or one that has been retired etc

/Composition.summary: manage the collection of resources of type Composition
/Composition.description: Access to services to manage the collection of all resources of type Composition

get.summary: Search all resources of type Composition based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
Multiple Resources: 

* [AllergyIntolerance](allergyintolerance.html): Date first version of the resource instance was recorded
* [CarePlan](careplan.html): Time period plan covers
* [CareTeam](careteam.html): A date within the coverage time period.
* [ClinicalImpression](clinicalimpression.html): When the assessment was documented
* [Composition](composition.html): Composition editing time
* [Consent](consent.html): When consent was agreed to
* [DiagnosticReport](diagnosticreport.html): The clinically relevant time of the report
* [Encounter](encounter.html): A date within the actualPeriod the Encounter lasted
* [EpisodeOfCare](episodeofcare.html): The provided date search value falls within the episode of care's period
* [FamilyMemberHistory](familymemberhistory.html): When history was recorded or last updated
* [Flag](flag.html): Time period when flag is active
* [Immunization](immunization.html): Vaccination  (non)-Administration Date
* [List](list.html): When the list was prepared
* [Observation](observation.html): Obtained date/time. If the obtained element is a period, a date that falls in the period
* [Procedure](procedure.html): When the procedure occurred or is occurring
* [RiskAssessment](riskassessment.html): When was assessment made?
* [SupplyRequest](supplyrequest.html): When the request was made

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description:
Multiple Resources: 

* [AllergyIntolerance](allergyintolerance.html): External ids for this item
* [CarePlan](careplan.html): External Ids for this plan
* [CareTeam](careteam.html): External Ids for this team
* [Composition](composition.html): Version-independent identifier for the Composition
* [Condition](condition.html): A unique identifier of the condition record
* [Consent](consent.html): Identifier for this record (external references)
* [DetectedIssue](detectedissue.html): Unique id for the detected issue
* [DeviceRequest](devicerequest.html): Business identifier for request/order
* [DiagnosticReport](diagnosticreport.html): An identifier for the report
* [DocumentManifest](documentmanifest.html): Unique Identifier for the set of documents
* [DocumentReference](documentreference.html): Identifier of the attachment binary
* [Encounter](encounter.html): Identifier(s) by which this encounter is known
* [EpisodeOfCare](episodeofcare.html): Business Identifier(s) relevant for this EpisodeOfCare
* [FamilyMemberHistory](familymemberhistory.html): A search by a record identifier
* [Goal](goal.html): External Ids for this goal
* [ImagingStudy](imagingstudy.html): Identifiers for the Study, such as DICOM Study Instance UID
* [Immunization](immunization.html): Business identifier
* [List](list.html): Business identifier
* [MedicationAdministration](medicationadministration.html): Return administrations with this external identifier
* [MedicationDispense](medicationdispense.html): Returns dispenses with this external identifier
* [MedicationRequest](medicationrequest.html): Return prescriptions with this external identifier
* [MedicationUsage](medicationusage.html): Return statements with this external identifier
* [NutritionOrder](nutritionorder.html): Return nutrition orders with this external identifier
* [Observation](observation.html): The unique id for a particular observation
* [Procedure](procedure.html): A unique identifier for a procedure
* [RiskAssessment](riskassessment.html): Unique identifier for the assessment
* [ServiceRequest](servicerequest.html): Identifiers assigned to this order
* [SupplyDelivery](supplydelivery.html): External identifier
* [SupplyRequest](supplyrequest.html): Business Identifier for SupplyRequest
* [VisionPrescription](visionprescription.html): Return prescriptions with this external identifier

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: The period covered by the documentation

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: Who and/or what authored the composition

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: Who and/or what the composition is about

parameters.name: section
parameters.description: Classification of section (recommended)

parameters.name: encounter
parameters.description:
Multiple Resources: 

* [Composition](composition.html): Context of the Composition
* [DeviceRequest](devicerequest.html): Encounter during which request was created
* [DiagnosticReport](diagnosticreport.html): The Encounter when the order was made
* [Flag](flag.html): Alert relevant during encounter
* [List](list.html): Context in which list created
* [NutritionOrder](nutritionorder.html): Return nutrition orders with this encounter identifier
* [Observation](observation.html): Encounter related to the observation
* [Procedure](procedure.html): The Encounter during which this Procedure was created
* [RiskAssessment](riskassessment.html): Where was assessment performed?
* [ServiceRequest](servicerequest.html): An encounter in which this request is made
* [VisionPrescription](visionprescription.html): Return prescriptions with this encounter identifier

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Human Readable name/title

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Multiple Resources: 

* [AllergyIntolerance](allergyintolerance.html): allergy | intolerance - Underlying mechanism (if known)
* [Composition](composition.html): Kind of composition (LOINC if possible)
* [DocumentManifest](documentmanifest.html): Kind of document set
* [DocumentReference](documentreference.html): Kind of document (LOINC if possible)
* [Encounter](encounter.html): Specific type of encounter
* [EpisodeOfCare](episodeofcare.html): Type/class  - e.g. specialist referral, disease management

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The business version of the activity definition

parameters.name: attester
parameters.description: Who attested the composition

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The uri that identifies the activity definition

parameters.name: section-text
parameters.description: Search on the section narrative of the resource

parameters.name: entry
parameters.description: A reference to data that supports this section

parameters.name: related
parameters.description: Target of the relationship

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description:
Multiple Resources: 

* [AllergyIntolerance](allergyintolerance.html): Who the sensitivity is for
* [CarePlan](careplan.html): Who the care plan is for
* [CareTeam](careteam.html): Who care team is for
* [ClinicalImpression](clinicalimpression.html): Patient assessed
* [Composition](composition.html): Who and/or what the composition is about
* [Condition](condition.html): Who has the condition?
* [Consent](consent.html): Who the consent applies to
* [DetectedIssue](detectedissue.html): Associated patient
* [DeviceRequest](devicerequest.html): Individual the service is ordered for
* [DeviceUsage](deviceusage.html): Search by patient who used / uses the device
* [DiagnosticReport](diagnosticreport.html): The subject of the report if a patient
* [DocumentManifest](documentmanifest.html): The subject of the set of documents
* [DocumentReference](documentreference.html): Who/what is the subject of the document
* [Encounter](encounter.html): The patient present at the encounter
* [EpisodeOfCare](episodeofcare.html): The patient who is the focus of this episode of care
* [FamilyMemberHistory](familymemberhistory.html): The identity of a subject to list family member history items for
* [Flag](flag.html): The identity of a subject to list flags for
* [Goal](goal.html): Who this goal is intended for
* [ImagingStudy](imagingstudy.html): Who the study is about
* [Immunization](immunization.html): The patient for the vaccination record
* [List](list.html): If all resources have the same subject
* [MedicationAdministration](medicationadministration.html): The identity of a patient to list administrations  for
* [MedicationDispense](medicationdispense.html): The identity of a patient to list dispenses  for
* [MedicationRequest](medicationrequest.html): Returns prescriptions for a specific patient
* [MedicationUsage](medicationusage.html): Returns statements for a specific patient.
* [NutritionOrder](nutritionorder.html): The identity of the individual or set of individuals who requires the diet, formula or nutritional supplement
* [Observation](observation.html): The subject that the observation is about (if patient)
* [Procedure](procedure.html): Search by subject - a patient
* [RiskAssessment](riskassessment.html): Who/what does assessment apply to?
* [ServiceRequest](servicerequest.html): Search by subject - a patient
* [SupplyDelivery](supplydelivery.html): Patient for whom the item is supplied
* [SupplyRequest](supplyrequest.html): The patient or subject for whom the supply is destined
* [VisionPrescription](visionprescription.html): The identity of a patient to list dispenses for

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Code(s) that apply to the event being documented

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Categorization of Composition

parameters.name: section-code-text
parameters.description: Search on the section narrative of the resource

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: preliminary | final | amended | entered-in-error

/Ingredient.summary: manage the collection of resources of type Ingredient
/Ingredient.description: Access to services to manage the collection of all resources of type Ingredient

get.summary: Search all resources of type Ingredient based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: substance-definition
parameters.description: Reference to a resource (by instance)

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: An identifier or code by which the ingredient can be referenced

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: A classification of the ingredient identifying its purpose within the product, e.g. active, inactive

parameters.name: function
parameters.description: A classification of the ingredient identifying its precise purpose(s) in the drug product. This extends the Ingredient.role to add more detail. Example: Antioxidant, Alkalizing Agent

parameters.name: substance
parameters.description: Reference to a resource (by instance)

parameters.name: for
parameters.description: The product which this ingredient is a constituent part of

parameters.name: substance-code
parameters.description: Reference to a concept (by class)

parameters.name: manufacturer
parameters.description: The organization that manufactures this ingredient

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status of this ingredient. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content

/MedicinalProductDefinition.summary: manage the collection of resources of type MedicinalProductDefinition
/MedicinalProductDefinition.description: Access to services to manage the collection of all resources of type MedicinalProductDefinition

get.summary: Search all resources of type MedicinalProductDefinition based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Business identifier for this product. Could be an MPID

parameters.name: ingredient
parameters.description: An ingredient of this product

parameters.name: master-file
parameters.description: A master file for to the medicinal product (e.g. Pharmacovigilance System Master File)

parameters.name: contact
parameters.description: A product specific contact, person (in a role), or an organization

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: If this medicine applies to human or veterinary uses

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The full product name

parameters.name: name-language
parameters.description: Language code for this name

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Regulatory type, e.g. Investigational or Authorized

parameters.name: characteristic
parameters.description: Allows the key product features to be recorded, such as "sugar free", "modified release", "parallel import"

parameters.name: characteristic-type
parameters.description: A category for the characteristic

parameters.name: product-classification
parameters.description: Allows the product to be classified by various systems

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status within the lifecycle of this product record. A high-level status, this is not intended to duplicate details carried elsewhere such as legal status, or authorization status

parameters.name: address-city

/_history.summary: Read a past version of resource instance of all types
/_history.description: Access a previous versions of all types

get.summary: Read the past states of all resources

parameters.name: _since
parameters.description: Only include resource versions that were created at or after the given instant in time

parameters.name: _at
parameters.description: Only include resource versions that were current at some point during the time period specified in the date time value (see Search notes on date searching)

get.summary: Search all resources of all types based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: Searches on the server assigned id

parameters.name: _list
parameters.description: Allows for the retrieval of resources that are referenced by a List resource or by one of the pre-defined functional lists

parameters.name: _has
parameters.description: Provides support for reverse chaining

parameters.name: _type
parameters.description: A resource type filter

parameters.name: _sort
parameters.description: Identifies where the resource comes from

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: How many resources to return

parameters.name: _include
parameters.description: Control over returning additional resources (see spec)

parameters.name: _revinclude
parameters.description: Control over returning additional resources (see spec)

parameters.name: _language
parameters.description: Language of the resource content

parameters.name: _in
parameters.description: Allows for the retrieval of resources that are active members of a CareTeam, Group, or List

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: When the resource version last changed

parameters.name: _profile
parameters.description: Profiles this resource claims to conform to

summary.name: _summary
summary.description: Requests the server to return a designated subset of the resource

format.name: _format
format.description: Specify alternative response formats by their MIME-types (when a client is unable acccess accept: header)

pretty.name: _pretty
pretty.description: Ask for a pretty printed response for human convenience

elements.name: _elements
elements.description: Requests the server to return a collection of elements from the resource

count.name: _count
count.description: The maximum number of search results on a page. The server is not bound to return the number requested, but cannot return more
